title: Felipe Fontana Vieira
text: Hello! My name is Felipe. I’m a PhD student in statistical data analysis at G(h)ent University. My main research is about latent interactions. More specifically, I’m involved with the “structural-after-measurement” (SAM) approach and its extensions in the context of nonlinear effects. My supervisor is Prof. Yves Rosseel (yes, the lavaan guy). Besides that, I’m also a co-lead together with some wonderful people for one team at Framework for Open and Reproducible Research Training (FORRT).

title: Curriculum vitae
text:
2024-present | PhD Researcher in Statistical Data Analysis, Department of Data-Analysis, Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences, Ghent University
2023-present | Subsequent Master’s degree in Statistical Data Analysis (M.Sc.), Faculty of Science, Ghent University.
2021-2023 | Master’s degree in Psychology (Theory and Research) (M.Sc.), Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences, KU Leuven.
2018-2021 | Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences, University of Coimbra.
